quote: Because I rant not, neither rave of what I feel, can you be so shallow as to dream that I feel nothing?
May be we are not such fools as we look. But though we be, we are well content, so long as we may be two fools together.
The love of all things was upon me, and a softness to them all, and a sense of having something even such as they had.
But God forbid any man to be a fool to love, and be loved, as I have been. Else would he have prevented it.
Sometimes when we are little we imagine how it would be to have wings but there is reason to suppose it is the same feeling birds have.
